intro: Commelina platyphylla var. balansae, commonly known as the broadleaf commelina, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Commelinaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive blue-violet flowers and broad, lance-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or wetlands. It has a rhizomatous root system that allows it to spread vegetatively. Its flowers are hermaphroditic, featuring both male and female reproductive structures.
